primaryIntroduction.title: An introduction for jhipster.de:
primaryIntroduction.p_1_1: This jhipster-Application is connected to a
p_1_3: and optimized and build after successful testing with a Jenkins-Server (as docker container)
and transferred with the jib-maven-plugin to a docker-registry (as another docker container).
Then Jenkins triggers a following task to connect to the docker-server and call some docker- and docker-compose commands to pull the new image
and rebuild and rerun the docker-container. This upgraded container offers his services here behind a nginx-proxy and nginx-proxy-companion running in some other
docker-containers. It is also connected to a postgresql-docker-container in a user-defined docker network.
The postgresql-container persists the applications data. In project changes the database can be migrated with liquibase.<br/
Docker uses an embedded DNS server in case of user-defined networks. This DNS server is announced to other containers on the network in /etc/resolv.conf as nameserver
with the IP 127.0.0.11 and resolves the container names to their docker network internal IPs!)
p_2: You can find the server-side docker-configuration of one of my servers here.
I hope, I have internalized the advantages of 'Convention-over-Configuration'-principles at this point to be able to offer preferably open-source
work on every layer on the one hand and did not compromise my server security on the other hand.
p_3: I advert to numerous ingenious and apparent unremittingly minds who enable me to be acquainted with the hippest techniques over which I was stumbling in my last twenty years (plus) of work experience
- free to use and with a lot of help to learn.
